wikipedia_page.main: John Barnard (6 July 1794 – 17 November 1878) was an English amateur first-class cricketer active from 1815 to 1830. He was born at Chislehurst in Kent and played mainly for Kent teams and the Marylebone Cricket Club. He made 18 known appearances in first-class matches, including for the Gentlemen in the Gentlemen v Players series.He was the brother of Henry W. Barnard who also played for Kent teams and for MCC. He died at Cambridge and is buried in the Mill Road cemetery, Cambridge.
